detail.content: Visit Us                                                                                        The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                                                                                 About             History & Mission The School and NYC Message from the Dean Academic Accreditation Administration Newsroom The School Community Convocation Visual Identity and Editorial Guidelines School Events                   Admissions             Graduate Admissions Undergraduate Admissions Events You@NYU Apply                   Academics             Academic Departments Academic Policies and Procedures Academic Accreditation Degree Programs Graduate Programs Undergraduate Programs Online Offerings Diploma Program Admissions  High School Academy Noncredit Offerings Course Search Certificates Intensives New Courses Online Offerings Professional Advantage Programs Information Sessions  Online Offerings                   Noncredit                 Faculty             Office of Faculty Affairs Faculty Search                   Career             About For Students For Employers For Alumni For Faculty                   Conferences & Events                 Giving                 Alumni             Alumni Community Stay Connected Alumni Benefits and Services Alumni Award Programs and Events                                                   Visit Us                                      Visit Us                         We know that the NYU School of Professional Studies is a great place to get an incredible education. Thousands of professionally-driven students from an array of life paths choose to enroll in our programs and leave satisfied, having earned a reputable and valuable degree. For this reason, we would love for you to come experience the NYU community for yourself.   Get to know our student body in person. Meet with our admissions staff about our wide range of programs. Tour our LEED-certified building. Wander through the tree-lined cobblestone streets on campus. Give in to the creative energy of the city.   Simply contact the Office of Admissions to arrange a time. We look forward to finding out more about you.            NYU School of Professional Studies Locations        The NYU School of Professional Studies classes are held at four convenient locations listed below. The location at 7 East 12th Street also houses the Office of Admissions.       The NYU School of Professional Studies Building at 7 East 12th Street   The Washington Square campus in Greenwich Village   The Midtown Graduate Center at 11 West 42nd Street   The Woolworth Building at 15 Barclay Street in downtown Manhattan     Please refer to the NYU campus map [PDF] for a more detailed view of our locations.             Expand All   Collapse All          7 East 12th Street        The NYU School of Professional Studies building at 7 East 12th Street serves as the on-campus home for the School's administrative offices and programs listed below.   At This Location       Office of Admissions     Paul McGhee Division   Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism   Tisch Institute for Sports Management, Media, and Business   Foreign Languages, Translation and Interpreting   American Language Institute (ALI) Administrative Offices   Humanities, Arts, and Writing   Administrative Offices     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the L, N, Q, R, 4, 5, or 6 line to the Union Square-14th Street stop.   By Train  From Penn Station, take the 1, 2, or 3 subway line to the 14th Street stop.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 4 or 5 subway line to the Union Square-14th Street stop.  Take a PATH train to the 14th Street Station.   By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 1 or 3 bus to the 5th Av-W. 12th stop.             Woolworth Building (15 Barclay Street)        15 Barclay Street, (the historic Woolworth Building), houses administrative offices, and classroom facilities for the programs listed below. The NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th floor of the building. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors may register at the desk in the lobby.   At This Location     The Center for Global Affairs   American Language Institute (ALI)       Getting Here   By Subway  Take the 2 or 3 line to the Park Place stop.  Take the 4, 5, 6, or R line to the Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall stop.  Take the A or C line to the Chambers Street stop.     By Train  From Penn Station, take the 2 or 3 subway line to the Park Place stop or the A or C to Chambers Street.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 4, 5, 6, or R subway line to the Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall stop.  Take a PATH train to the World Trade Center Station.   By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 5 bus to the City Hall stop.               Washington Square Campus        Many NYU School of Professional Studies classes meet on the Washington Square campus, the center of NYU in the heart of Greenwich Village. One of the City's most creative and energetic communities, the Village is an historic neighborhood that has attracted generations of writers, musicians, artists, and intellectuals.   At This Location     The Paul McGhee Division (select courses)   M.S. in Fundraising and Grantmaking     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the 6 line to the Astor Place stop.  Take the N or R line to the 8th Street stop (at Broadway).  Take the A, B, C, D, E, F, or M line to the West 4th Street-Washington Square stop.  Take the 1 line to the Christopher Street-Sheridan Square stop.   By Train   From Penn Station, take the A, B, C, D, E, F, or M subway line to the West 4th Street stop or the 1 to Christopher Street.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 6 subway line to the Astor Place stop.  Take a PATH train to the 9th Street and Avenue of the Americas Station.     By Bus  From Fifth Avenue, take the No. 1, 2, 3, or 5 bus to 8th Street and University Place.  From 8th Street Crosstown take the No. 8 bus to University Place.  From Broadway, take the No. 5 bus to Waverly Place.  From the Avenue of the Americas, take the No. 5 bus to Waverly Place.             NYU Midtown Center (11 West 42nd Street)        At 11 West 42nd Street (the NYU Midtown Center), the NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 4th, 5th, and 10th floors. Facilities include classrooms, graduate academic department and administrative offices, and the Brause Real Estate Library. The Midtown Center also features a café and a computer lab. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors must register at the desk in the lobby.   At This Location     Schack Institute of Real Estate   Center for Publishing   Center for Advanced Digital Applications   NYU School of Professional Studies programs in Human Resource Management and Development ; Integrated Marketing ; Management and Systems ; Public Relations and Corporate Communication ; and Translation   International Student Support Center     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the B, D, F, or M line to the 42nd Street stop (at Avenue of the Americas).  Take the 7 line to the 42nd Street stop (at Fifth Avenue).  Take the 4, 5, or 6 line to the 42nd Street-Grand Central Station stop.  Take the 1, 2, 3, N, Q, or R line to the 42nd Street-Times Square stop.     By Train  From Penn Station, walk outside one block east and take the B, D, F, or M subway line to the 42nd Street stop.  From Grand Central Terminal, walk three blocks west to the NYU Midtown Center.  Take a PATH train to 33rd Street and then take the B, D, F, or M subway line to the 42nd Street stop.     By Bus  From Fifth Avenue take the No. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or Q32 bus to 42nd Street.  From Avenue of the Americas, take the No. 5 or 7 bus to 42nd Street.  From Madison Avenue, take the No. 1, 2, 3, or 4 bus to 42nd Street.  From Crosstown take the No. 42 or 104 bus to 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue. Directions                                                                                                     NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. JavaScript is either disabled or not supported by your browser. For instructions on how to enable JavaScript in your browser, click here .                    Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Navigation   Skip to Sub Navigation                                                             New York University College of Dentistry                                   Search NYUCD                                                                                                                       Main Navigation                                                                About                                                            Admissions/Academic Programs                                              Departments/Faculty                                              Research                                              Student Life                                              Alumni                                              CDE                                              Global Reach                                              Patients                                              About             Directions                The NYU College of Dentistry is located at 345 E. 24 th Street (corner of First Avenue) in Manhattan.   Getting here using mass transit:     M15 bus or M15 SelectBusService up First Avenue or down Second Avenue to 23 rd Street.   M23 crosstown bus east on 23 rd Street to First Avenue.   M34A crosstown bus east on 34 th Street, down Second Avenue to 23 rd Street and First Avenue.   M21 bus along Houston Street, up Avenue C to First Avenue and 23rd Street.   Subway: 6, N, R, F, C, or E to 23 rd Street stop; transfer to M23 crosstown bus to First Avenue and 23 rd Street.     For more information on trains, subways and buses, including maps and schedules, visit the New York Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA) website: http://www.mta.nyc.ny.us/   By car:   The closest parking garages are on 25 th Street between First and Second Avenues.   Patients: To schedule an appointment, please call (212) 998-9800.                                                                                                                      How To Get To NYUCD                               For detailed information on travelling to and from local airports : The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey - http://www.panynj.gov/     For information on trains, subways and buses, including maps and schedules: New York Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA) - http://www.mta.info     Lexington Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east to First Avenue and north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Seventh Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Broadway Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east to First Avenue and north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Sixth or Eighth Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     First, Second, and Third Avenue Buses  First and Third Avenue buses run north. Second Avenue bus runs south. Take bus to 24th Street. Walk to the College of Dentistry.     Lincoln Tunnel  NJ Turnpike, Rts. 3, 1, and 9 to Lincoln Tunnel; Downtown exit 30–34th Street; make left on 34th or 30th Street; right turn on Ninth Avenue; make left onto 23rd Street; take 23rd Street to First Avenue; make left onto 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Holland Tunnel  NJ Turnpike, Rts. 1 and 9 to Holland Tunnel; Uptown exit (Hudson Street turns into Eighth Avenue); make right turn onto 23rd Street; take 23rd Street to First Avenue. Make left onto 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     From La Guardia Airport  Take Carey bus from arrivals area. Bus runs daily into the city every 20 minutes from 7 a.m. to midnight. (718) 632-0506.     From Kennedy Airport  Take Carey bus at any arrivals terminal. Bus runs daily into the city every 30 minutes from 7 a.m. to midnight.  or  Take the Air Train to Jamaica. take the E train to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.  (718) 632-0506.     From Newark Airport  Take Olympia Trails bus at all arrival terminals. Buses run daily into the city every 15 minutes from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. (212) 964-6233.  or  Take the Air Train to Newark Liberty International Airport Train Station to connect to NJ Transit. take NJ Transit to New York Penn Station. take a local train to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk North to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.                                                              Recommended Hotel Accommodations                               Below is a list of recommended hotels near NYU College of Dentistry   Affinia - Dumont  150 East 34th Street,  bet. 3rd and Lexington Avenues  Phone: (212) 481-7600 or (800) 637-8483  Fax: (212) 889-8856   www.affinia.com/New-York-City-Hotel.aspx?name=Affinia-Dumont  Use the NYU Medical Corporate Rate – code #NYUMED.     The Carlton Hotel  88 Madison Avenue  bet. 28th & 29th Streets  Phone: (212) 532-4100 or (800) 601-8500  Fax: (212) 696-9758   www.carltonhotelny.com  Ask for NYU special discounted rate.     Club Quarters Midtown  40 West 45th Street,  bet. Fifth & Sixth Avenues  Phone: (212) 354-6400  Fax: (212) 575-5696  http://clubquarters.com/new-york/midtown  Ask for NYU special discounted rate.     Hotel Thirty Thirty  30 East 30th Street  bet. Madison & Park Avenues  Phone: (212) 689-1900 or (800) 804-4480  Fax: (212) 689-0023  Ask for NYU special discounted rate.     Marcel Hotel  201 East 24th Street &  3rd Avenue  Phone: (212) 696-3800 or (800) 555-7555 or (407) 740-6442 for intl  Fax: (212) 696-0077   www.hotelmarcelnewyork.com  Ask for NYU special discounted rate.     Wyndham Garden Hotel  37 West 24th Street  bet. 5th & 6th Avenues  Phone: (212) 243-0800 or 1-800-Wyndham  Fax: (212)243-0900   www.wyndham.com/wbe/reservations.wnt?pro=NYCCW&cor=44860803&cha=WYNDHAMCORP  Ask for NYU special discounted rate.                                                                  Parking                               Dan's East 23rd Parking, INC.  320 East 23rd Street (between 1st & 2nd Avenues)  Phone: (212) 674-2918  Open 24 hours     Quick Park  401 2nd Avenue (between 23rd & 24th St. on the right side)  Phone: (212) 683-4009  Open 24 hours     NY Parking East 24th  200 East 24th Street (between 2nd & 3rd Avenues on the right side)  Phone: (212) 684-9001  Open 24 hours     Meyers Parking  300 East 25th Street (between 1st & 2nd Avenues on the left side)  Phone: (212) 213-1349  Open 24 hours Patients: To schedule an appointment, please call (212) 998-9800.                                                                                                                      How To Get To NYUCD                               For detailed information on travelling to and from local airports : The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey - http://www.panynj.gov/     For information on trains, subways and buses, including maps and schedules: New York Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA) - http://www.mta.info     Lexington Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east to First Avenue and north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Seventh Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Broadway Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east to First Avenue and north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Sixth or Eighth Avenue Subway  Local to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     First, Second, and Third Avenue Buses  First and Third Avenue buses run north. Second Avenue bus runs south. Take bus to 24th Street. Walk to the College of Dentistry.     Lincoln Tunnel  NJ Turnpike, Rts. 3, 1, and 9 to Lincoln Tunnel; Downtown exit 30–34th Street; make left on 34th or 30th Street; right turn on Ninth Avenue; make left onto 23rd Street; take 23rd Street to First Avenue; make left onto 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     Holland Tunnel  NJ Turnpike, Rts. 1 and 9 to Holland Tunnel; Uptown exit (Hudson Street turns into Eighth Avenue); make right turn onto 23rd Street; take 23rd Street to First Avenue. Make left onto 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.     From La Guardia Airport  Take Carey bus from arrivals area. Bus runs daily into the city every 20 minutes from 7 a.m. to midnight. (718) 632-0506.     From Kennedy Airport  Take Carey bus at any arrivals terminal. Bus runs daily into the city every 30 minutes from 7 a.m. to midnight.  or  Take the Air Train to Jamaica. take the E train to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk north to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry.  (718) 632-0506.     From Newark Airport  Take Olympia Trails bus at all arrival terminals. Buses run daily into the city every 15 minutes from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. (212) 964-6233.  or  Take the Air Train to Newark Liberty International Airport Train Station to connect to NJ Transit. take NJ Transit to New York Penn Station. take a local train to 23rd Street Station. Walk east or take 23rd Street crosstown bus to First Avenue. Walk North to 24th Street to the College of Dentistry. Follow Us                                            About Second Street     Second Street is a dynamic community located in the unique and vibrant East Village, close to the LES, Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy. This residence hall is home to approximately 300 residents, eight Resident Assistants, 3 professional staff members and a Faculty Fellow in Residence. Second Street is home to the explorations community, the Chinese Floor. The student population is comprised of undergraduates varying from sophomores, juniors, seniors, transfer, and international students. Second Street has 12 floors with studio singles, doubles and duplex triples. The building is air-conditioned and each room has its own kitchenette and bathroom. Our facilities include a large communal lounge and a game room with a TV and pool table. In addition, we have two music practice rooms, a dance room, an art room, a bike room and study room with a computer lab. Check out our blog to learn more about Second Street!
